thread.title: Volleyball: Farragut beats Bearden for title
thread.title_full: Volleyball: Farragut beats Bearden for title

title: Volleyball: Farragut beats Bearden for title
text:
Volleyball: Farragut knocks off Bearden for district title Dave Link 10:48 PM, Oct 8, 2015 Copyright 2015 Journal Media Group. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. Show Caption Previous Next 
Farragut High School's volleyball team was in full stride again Thursday night while reclaiming the District 4-AAA tournament title. 
The host Lady Admirals beat rival Bearden 25-21, 25-21, 25-17 and won the district tournament for the first time since 2012. 
Farragut (41-5) lost to Bearden (19-14) in the district championship match the past two years. 
"I'm proud of the girls," Farragut coach Susan Davidson said. "Bearden has a great team. We may see them again." 
Both teams advance to the Region 2-AAA tournament next Tuesday at Anderson County. 
Farragut will play Oak Ridge, and Bearden will play Anderson County in region semifinals with the championship to follow later Tuesday. 
Region finalists advance to next Thursday's state sectional matches. 
"It's been awesome," said Farragut junior Alexis Parker, the district tournament MVP. "Our team really works together well. We practice together well. Everything has started clicking." 
Bearden earned a spot in the district final by beating Hardin Valley Academy 22-25, 25-23, 25-20, 25-15 earlier Thursday. 
The Lady Bulldogs trailed 17-7 in the second set. 
"Our first match took a lot out of us," Bearden coach Zach Forgani said. "Not only emotionally, we had to fight back. But you can't take anything away from Farragut. They're an amazing team with amazing players." 
Parker had 18 kills and six blocks as Farragut improved to 3-0 against Bearden this year. 
Farragut junior hitter/libero Madi Howell had 11 service aces, seven kills and nine digs; Mikaela Brock had 17 digs and three aces, setter Tia Madden had 21 assists and five digs and setter Sydney Cherney had 14 assists, nine kills and four aces. 
Bearden junior Chesney McClellan had 12 kills, 12 digs, and four blocks, Logan Kael had 31 digs and Madi Matthew had nine kills, nine digs and four blocks. 
"Bearden has a great team with great coaches," Parker said. "We both played a good game. We just managed to pull it out." 
East/Middle Region 
The King's Academy def. Battle Ground Academy 25-12, 25-19, 25-27, 25-17: Callie Greene's 24 points helped the Lady Lions advance to the region tournament semifinals. TKA will play either Zion Christian or Donelson Christian at BGA on Saturday at 12:30 p.m. for a substate berth. Webb, which beat Davidson Academy on Thursday, will play Friendship Christian in the other semifinal at 12:30. 
Region 2-A 
Berean Advances: Berean Christian fell to South Greene in five sets in the tournament final, but still clinched a Class A state sectional berth. 
District 2-AAA 
Morristown West def. Morristown East 25-13, 19-25, 25-16, 25-27, 15-9: Blayke Shultz had 30 digs and 10 points as the Lady Trojans won the tournament title. Both teams advance to next week's Region 1-AAA tournament at either Science Hill or Tennessee High. 
District 3-AA 
Gatlinburg-Pittman def. Carter 25-12, 25-13, 25-23: Julia Maloney posted 19 digs and 13 kills, and Macee Tinker had 19 assists as the Lady Highlanders cruised to the tournament title. Gatlinburg-Pittman advanced to the final by beating Union County 25-9, 25-22, 25-15. Carter topped Fulton in the other semifinal. 
Both teams advance to Tuesday's Region 2-AA tournament at Rocky Top Sports World in Gatlinburg. Gatlinburg-Pittman will take on District 4-AA runner-up Christian Academy of Knoxville at 5:30 p.m. Carter will play 4-AA winner Catholic at 5:30. 
District 2-AA 
Greeneville def. Grainger 25-18, 25-22, 25-21: Courtney Dotson earned tournament MVP honors as the Lady Devils cruised to a title. Greeneville will face Elizabethton in Tuesday's Region 1-AA tournament at Sullivan South. Grainger advances to play District 1-AA champion Sullivan South. 
District 3-A 
Concord Christian def. Grace Christian 25-13, 25-17, 25-23: Allie Koepfer was named tournament MVP after the Lady Lions cruised to their first district title. Both teams advance to Tuesday's Region 2-A tournament at Concord Christian. The Lady Lions will play District 3-A runner-up Coalfield. Grace Christian will play Jellico. 
Dave Link is a freelance contributor. Chris Thomas contributed to this report. Copyright 2015 Journal Media Group. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed.
